intro: Acinodendron polyandrum, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny leaves. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible but have a tart flavor. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in ornamental gardening and for soil stabilization.
